project.teaser: "The AREANA project addresses the call for ""Aviation research synergies between Horizon Europe, AZEA and National programs"" by providing advanced novel approaches to foster the European aviation research ecosystem. It encompasses three interconnected, yet thematically...
project.objective:
"The AREANA project addresses the call for ""Aviation research synergies between Horizon Europe, AZEA and National programs"" by providing advanced novel approaches to foster the European aviation research ecosystem. It encompasses three interconnected, yet thematically distinct parts. Firstly, approaches improving on the coordination of aviation funding programs will be addressed by coordinating and supporting synergies between European, National, and Regional R&I aviation programs. The project aims to facilitate joint calls or other co-funding mechanisms that align EU, National, and Regional activities in specific fields and accelerate the update and sharing of aviation technology infrastructures in the European Research Area. Secondly, the upcoming Aerodays will be prepared. The consortium suggests them to take place during the first half of 2025 in Warsaw, Poland. They would then coincide with the Polish presidency of the Council of the European Union. Thirdly, AZEA (Alliance for Zero Emission Aviation) activities will be supported by conducting mappings and analysis, including the identification of potential technological and administrative gaps and lack of related R&I and standardization efforts, removing the obstacles for zero-emission aviation. Close cooperation with the Advisory Council for Aviation Research and Innovation in Europe (ACARE) and other institutions is expected. The AREANA project will help to sustain and foster the European aviation research ecosystem, thus helping to achieve the environmental goals while ensuring European competitiveness. This will be achieved by connecting and aligning different funding mechanisms, bringing together aviation stakeholders during the Aerodays and supporting the Alliance for Zero Emission Aviation.
"
project.title: AVIATION RESEARCH ECOSYSTEM ADVANCED NOVEL APPROACH
project.keywords: aviation, national programs, europen programs, zero emission, hydrogen, ecosystems, novel, synergies, collaboration and common appoach

article.title: Europe’s aviation research landscape faces a critical challenge

result.title: ENR Survey Evaluation
result.description: A survey will be developed to gather and compile information on the relevant institutions and grants. The survey results and existing funding models will be evaluated, so as to determine which specific approaches towards joint calls have the highest potential to be endorsed by existing funding bodies and supplied by the required finances.

result.title: IT Concept
result.description: An IT concept will be developed and will include a provisional platform providing funding bodies with a point of contact, current strategical interests or information on probable upcoming calls. This concept will evaluate IT-tools provided by the ECARE project and propose possible adjustments for optimal European, National and Regional R&I cooperation.

result.title: Homepage WP 1
result.description: A dedicated homepage will be developed for the dissemination purposes of WP1. It shall include, among others, updated information on its topmost latest activities, progress, news and outcomes.

result.title: Event
result.description: Regarding the production of the Event the following steps will be taken: the venue is prepared to accommodate attendees and participants. The Registration and Check-in Points are open and ready for participants and guests arrival. They will receive event badges or identification, event materials, and any relevant information about the day's schedule. All ceremonies are planned and prepared technically (scene, audio equipment, screen etc). Speakers and Presenters are present. All rooms are marked and ready for participants, the expo room is ready. Organising team is in contact with the technical staff, ready to mitigate any potential problems that may occur (technical problems with audio or vision, delays, problems with finding the rooms etc).

result.title: Non-EU Country Report
result.description: Summary on the level of commitment outside the EU to cooperate with the EU efforts on closer coordinated aviation research. A detailed position on all three aspects (strategy WP1.3, design WP 1.4 and administration WP 1.5) for the non-EU nations (excluding EU associated countries covered by deliverable D6) participating in the call, including related regions will be reported. A wider review of non-EU countries shall be included with a focus on countries who may be able to actively contribute to European research.

result.title: Website available
result.description: Establishing and opening of the Event Website is a part of the Event itself. It will serve as the guide for the Participants. Here they could find information regarding the event preparation, registration to the event, information for exhibitors, information for sponsors and Event detailed programme.

result.title: Overall planning of the event – location, date, establishing Advisory Board and Technical Committee, promotion plan
result.description: Selecting an appropriate location is crucial for the success of the event. Consider factors such as accessibility, transportation options, accommodation facilities, and local amenities. Choosing the right date is essential to ensure maximum participation. It requires checking for any conflicting events or holidays that might impact attendance. Aim for a date that allows sufficient time for preparation and promotion.Establishing an Advisory Board: Forming an Advisory Board is beneficial for gaining expert insights and industry knowledge. They can provide guidance on event content, speakers, and overall direction.Establishing a Technical Committee: The committee will review submissions, select presentations, and ensure the event maintains a high standard of quality and relevance.Establishing a Promotion Plan which is essential to reach the target audience and generate interest in the event.

result.title: Event programme
result.description: A well-designed event program is a crucial element in ensuring a successful and engaging event. It will serve as a guide for attendees, providing them with essential information about the event's schedule, speakers, sessions, and activities. The focus while planning will be put on: Event Overview, Scheduling,Keynote Speakres, Details on Sessions, Networking Opportunities, Panel Discussions, VIP Guests.

result.title: Potential synergies between European, National and Regional R&I aviation programmes
result.description: Potential synergies by compiling EU funded collaborative research aviation projects (mainly managed by CINEA) and other main National and Regional R&I aviation programmes will be explored.These results will be publishable and documents will be distributed during the ILA 2024, which will be taking place between 5-9 June 2024.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
